sources.title: Blackmail Hitchcock 1929
sources.description: England’s first “talkie” feature film, starring Anny Ondra, John Longden, and Cyril Ritchard. (1929) Hitchcock. (By the way: for those fans of "The Sweeney" this is the 1st movie in which the Flying Squad is referenced (if you pay attention) it involves detectives from the early "Flying Squad." (Be patient. The vocals come in at about the 8 mark.) The subject matter is extremely controversial for the day and some scenes were - what were then considered extremely risqué.

metadata.Plot: Alice White is the daughter of a shopkeeper in 1920s London. Her boyfriend, Frank Webber is a Scotland Yard detective who seems more interested in police work than in her. Frank takes Alice out one night, but she has secretly arranged to meet another man. Later that night, Alice agrees to go back to his flat to see his studio. The man has other ideas, and as he tries to rape Alice, she defends herself and kills him with a bread knife. When the body is discovered, Frank is assigned to the case, he quickly determines that Alice is the killer, but so has someone else, and blackmail is threatened.
metadata.Writer: Charles Bennett, Alfred Hitchcock, Benn W. Levy
metadata.Actors: Anny Ondra, John Longden, Sara Allgood
